SOURCE: Annales Altahenses maiores, ed. W. von Giesebrecht and E.L.B. von Oefele, MGH SRG [4] (Hanover 1891)
SOURCE SUMMARY: Ingens eruptio aquarum

SOURCE: Annales Quedlinburgenses, ed. G.H. Pertz, MGH SS 3 (1839)
SOURCE SUMMARY: (refer to a flood on Tues 15.xii.1013)

SOURCE: Annales Ratisponenses, ed. W. Wattenbach MGH SS 17(1861)
SOURCE SUMMARY: insolita effusio fluminum

SOURCE: Thietmar of Merseburg, Chronicon, ed. R. Holtzmann, Die Chronik des Bischofs Thietmar von Merseburg, MGH SRG n.s. 6 (Berlin, 1935)
SOURCE SUMMARY: (from A Quedl acc ed. --am not convinced the source is correct, Thietmar adds many more details-- but misplaced under 1012; Ann Quedl 82 refer to a flood on Tues 15.xii.1013)

SOURCE: Passio Colomanni (BHL 1881), 7, ed. G. Waitz, MGH SS 4 (1841)
SOURCE SUMMARY: Sequenti igitur anno Danubius effreni licentia littorum curva itinera devagatus. pleraque edificia suis viribus eruta funditus ingurgitavit, et queque loca sibi contigua estuantis diluvii copiis inebriavit; atrium autem basilice, iuxta quam beati Cholomanni cadaver requievit, tanta diluvies replevit, ut medietas ecclesie vix appareret. Set omnipotentis Dei clementia per famuli sui merita ostendite miracula, nostris quoque temporibus inaudita. Nam tumulus quo claudebatur corpus ipsius, aquarum diluvio non attingebatur penitus. (in the year after the St's murder on 18.x.1012, Danube flooded terribly, but his shrine was spared)

SOURCE: Fragmentum historiae Francicae (Fragmenta Chronici Floriacensis), RHGF 11(1876)
SOURCE SUMMARY: (Loire floods beyond its banks twice; season not specified, mentioned after solar eclipse post octavas Paschae, hour 1, i.e. sometime after ca. 18.iv)

SOURCE: Annales Corbienses, ed. P. Jaffé, Bibliotheca rerum Germanicarum 1 (Berlin, 1864)
SOURCE SUMMARY: Vindemia hoc anno periit; sed et mel similiter carum fuit (wine harvest failed; honey similarly expensive). Testifies to poor growing conditions; cause not clear.

SOURCE: Herimann of Reichenau, Chronicon, ed. G.H. Pertz, MGH SS 5 (Hanover, 1844)
SOURCE SUMMARY: Maxima pestis pecudum, et hiems satis dura et nivosa magnam vinearum partem frigore perdidit, et frugum sterilitas famem non modicam effecit. (Great murrain, fairly harsh and snowy winter killed many vines by freezing, and produced a famine which was not small). Implies at least heavy winter precipitation.

SOURCE: Annales Altahenses maiores, ed. W. von Giesebrecht and E.L.B. von Oefele, MGH SRG [4] (Hanover 1891)
SOURCE SUMMARY: (poor grain harvest, poor, sour wine )

SOURCE: Annales Augustani, ed. G.H. Pertz MGH SS 3 (1839)
SOURCE SUMMARY: inundatio pluviarum (flood of rains)

SOURCE: Berthold of Reichenau, Chronicon, ed. G.H. Pertz, MGH SS 3 (1839)
SOURCE SUMMARY: Totus ille annus pluvialis (rained whole year)

SOURCE: Annales Weissenburgenses, ed. O. Holder-Egger, Lamperti monachi Hersfeldensis opera, MGH SRG [38] (Hanover, 1894)
SOURCE SUMMARY: aquae inundaverunt (flood: unparalleled) magna et ante inaudita (failure of apple and grape harvest)

SOURCE: Annales Augustani, ed. G.H. Pertz MGH SS 3 (1839)
SOURCE SUMMARY: (dark winter followed by dry windy spring )

SOURCE: Cosmas of Prague, Chronica Boemorum 3, 47 and 48 ed. B. Bretholz MGH SRG n.s. 2 (1923)
SOURCE SUMMARY: Nimis attenuate sunt segetes propter nimiam siccitatem, que fuit per tres continuos menses, Marcium scilicet et Aprilem atque Maium. …Eiusdem anni fuit hiemps nimis ventosa et calida et aquarum inundatio magna. (Crops very deficient because of drought that lasted 3 months, i.e. March, April and May. WInter of that year was very windy and warm; there was great flooding.)

SOURCE: Annales Egmundenses, ed. O. Oppermann, Fontes Egmundenses,  Werken uitgegeven door het historisch Genootschap, 3, 61 (Utrecht, 1933)
SOURCE SUMMARY: ...a festivitate sancti Laurentii usque ad festum sancit Martini continua pluvia fuit, ita ut omnes pene fructus in agris putrefierent, annonae, fabae et pisae. (from the feast of St. Lawrence [viii.10] to that of St. Martin [xi.11], there was continuous rain such that nearly all the crops rotted in the fields: wheat, beans and peas.

SOURCE: Annales S. Petri Erphesfurtensis antiqui, ed. O. Holder-Egger MGH SRG [42] (1899)
SOURCE SUMMARY: Magda inundatio aquae fuit III. Non. Sept. (3.ix)

SOURCE: Annales Mellicenses, Auctarium Cremifanense, ed. W. Wattenbach, MGH SS 9 (1851)
SOURCE SUMMARY: Multa inundatio aquarum hoc anno facta est.

SOURCE: Continuatio Sigeberti Aquicinensis, ed. L. Bethmann, MGH SS 6
SOURCE SUMMARY: Estas nimium fuit sicca et calida. Messis triticea provenit uberior solito. Post finem mensis Augusti, autumpnus nimis extitit pluvialis. Vindemia etiam ipsius temporis multis in locis corrupta est. Nam quadam matutinali nebula uve contacte atque ita putrefacte sunt, ut vinum ex eis expressum magnam bibentibus attulerit incommoditatem. Multi etiam in hac nostra regione diversis laborant febribus, multi et moriuntur. (drought and hot summer: grain harvest better than usual, rainy after ix.01, grapes rot)

SOURCE: Geoffroi de Vigeois [de Bruil], Chronicon (Gaufredi Coenobitae Vosiensis) ed. RHGF 12 (1877)
SOURCE SUMMARY: …siccitas magna apud nos fuit mense sexto (great drought in June)

SOURCE: The Chronicle of Robert of Torigny, ed. R. Howlett, Rolls Series 82.4 (London, 1882)
SOURCE SUMMARY: great drought in summer and fall:

SOURCE: Annales Pragenses, ed. G.H. Pertz, MGH SS 3 (1839)
SOURCE SUMMARY: (great drought poor harvest)

SOURCE: Annales Gotwicenses, ed. W. Wattenbach MGH SS 9 (1851 )
SOURCE SUMMARY: Hoc anno instante messe inundatio ............ non repente veniens sed paulatim crescens et pene per mensem dur ...... omnem annonam que satis larga creverat sub d ............. annichilans putrefecit. Danubius .............. non solum adiacentes verum etiam longe positas villas ......................(Danube flooded for 1 month at the beginning of harvest time)

SOURCE: Annales Mellicenses, Continuatio Mellicensis, ed. W. Wattenbach MGH SS 9 (1851)
SOURCE SUMMARY: Pluvia maxima repente effusa est, et inundatione facta multi homines perierunt, 3. Kal. Iunii die dominico circa meridiem. Item tempore messis 5. Id. Aug. pluvia incipiente, et septem dies continuos durante, Danubius aquarum habundantia supra duos cubitos intumescens, continua aedificia plurima ingurgitavit, et effusus per campestria, que messa fuerant auferens, vineta quoque et prata sabulo sternens, in suo tractu maximam cladem exercuit. Reliqua passim per agros tam ea que messa fuerant, quam que meti non poterant, putruerunt.(heavy rains, flooding v, rains from viii.09-16, Danube floods (again), ruins grape grain harvest)

SOURCE: Chronica regia Colonienses, Continuatio II, ed. G. Waitz MGH SRG [18] (1880)
SOURCE SUMMARY: Estas sicca et nimium fervida. (summer dry and too hot)

SOURCE: Continutatio S. Dionysii, Cotton MS, ed. H.F. Delaborde, Oeuvres de Rigord et de Guillaume le Breton (Paris 1882-5)
SOURCE SUMMARY: In eodem anno sextarius annone venditus fuit Parisius xvi solidis Parisiensium, et fuit raritas frugum per universum regnum Francie, a mari Anglie usque ad alveum fluminis Ligeris. Tempore quo frequentabantur nundine Endicti prope Sanctum Dionysium, tante et tam frequenter oriebantur tempestates horridissime, quod infra octo dies interfecti fuerunt in pago Belvacensi et Parisiaco per loca ictibus fulminum quadraginta homines et quidam auriga et jumentum suum in exitu Endicti fulminati sunt die Jovis post festum sancti Johannis. In castro quod dicitur Petrafontis, dum presbyter divinis intenderet sacramentis, ita tonuit et pluit quod in eadem ecclesia quinque homines mortui fuerunt, et ipse sacerdos et viginti quatuor alii homines adeo lesi et vulnerati fuerunt, quod longo tempore post vix convalescere potuerunt ; calix in altari fuit comminutus per frusta, Eucharistia remanente integra et intacta. Sequenti die Veneris, ante festum beati Petri-ad-vincula, fulminata et damnificata est domus Eleemosyne juxta ecclesiam Beate Marie Parisius, et domus Eleemosyne an te ecclesiam Sancti Stephani de Monte ; et in duobus aliis locis ceciderunt fulmina in Parisiaca civitate ; quidam carpentarius fuit fulmine interfectus. (From 9.vi-30.vii (Lendit fair of that year to Friday before feast of St. Peter ad vincula) strong and frequent storms, many people killed and buildings struck by many lightning storms and a flood. Wheat prices soar, and cereal shortage from English channel to Loire.)

SOURCE: Annales Polonorum IV AND Annales Cracovienses compilati, ed. R. Röpell and W. Arndt, MGH SS 19 (1866)
SOURCE SUMMARY: (3 years of rain and floods in Poland)

SOURCE: Annales Parchenses, ed. G.H. Pertz MGH SS 16 (1859)
SOURCE SUMMARY: flood: facta est inundatio apud Lovanium, que transivit refectorium versus atrium.

SOURCE: Continutatio S. Dionysii, Cotton MS, ed. H.F. Delaborde, Oeuvres de Rigord et de Guillaume le Breton (Paris 1882-5)
SOURCE SUMMARY: see above

SOURCE: Emonis et Menkonis Werumensium Chronica, ed. L. Weiland, MGH SS 23 (1874)
SOURCE SUMMARY: great drought

SOURCE: Annales Basileenses, ed. Ph. Jaffé, MGH SS 17 (1861)
SOURCE SUMMARY: floods, high Rhine c. 25 July

SOURCE: Annales Polonorum IV AND Annales Capituli Cracoviensis, ed. R. Röpell and W. Arndt, MGH SS 19 (1866)
SOURCE-P: Ann. Polonorum: SS 19:638; Ann. Capit. Cracov. 19:604
SOURCE SUMMARY: great flood 22-27 July

SOURCE: Canonicorum Pragensium Continuatio Cosmae, ed. *G. Pertz MGH SS 9 (1851)
SOURCE SUMMARY: winter & spg crops died, fruit mediocre, wine abundant

SOURCE: Herman of Niederalteich, Hermanni Altahensis Annales, ed. *G. Pertz MGH SS 17 (1861)
SOURCE SUMMARY: drought destroys seedlings, abundant wine harvest

SOURCE: Cronica Floridi horti, in Kroniek van het klooster Bloemhof te Wittewierum, ed. H.P.H. Jansen 449 and A. Janse (Hilversum, 1991)
SOURCE SUMMARY: In 1271 the chronicler records that hunger and a sheep mortality increased because it was the third year of constant rain, i.e. 1269 and 1270 had also been very rainy. 1272 was the 4th year of rain: grain harvest very poor in Frisia, had to be imported from Denmark and Slavic countries where harvests were abundant. Eodem anno [1271] cepit crescere fames et ovium pestilentia propter iugem pluviam trium annorum.  ….[in 1272] propter nimiam pluviam per quatuor annos nimis modicum creverat frumentum, et maxime in Silvis [=de Wolden], ubi aliis temporibus solebat abundare; nec etiam in Threntia [Drente], nec secus Emesam [i.e. area around the Ems, nec alibi ad emendum inveniebatur, nisi in Dacia [Denmark] et Slavia [the Slavlands], ubi Dominus, qui irascitur et miseretur, dedït magnam copiam frumenti..... The entry for 1270 is almost entirely devoted to the 9th Crusade and the role of Frisian participants, hence probably the failure to mention the rain in that year.

SOURCE: Konstanzer Chronik, ed. F.J. Mone, Quellensammlung der badischen Landesgeschichte, vol. 1 (1848)
SOURCE SUMMARY: After very cold winter --Bodensee frozen solid on ii.14-- Spring, summer, winter dry, "edel" ("fine"): good wine harvest, good grain harvest

SOURCE SUMMARY: cold and then dry weather ruins crops

SOURCE: J. Titow, "Evidence of weather in the account rolls of the bishopric of Winchester 1209-1350," The Economic History Review, New Series 12 (1960): 360-407
SOURCE SUMMARY: S England v dry summer; autumn wet?

SOURCE SUMMARY: drought in Normandy: tanta siccitas in partibus istis quod eciam fontes siccaverunt.

SOURCE SUMMARY: Estas presentis anni autumpno utique siccissimo binis proximo preteritis per multa non congruit, quum in illis major siccitas, in hac vero pluviarum et tempestatum humiditas habundavit, quarum tempestatum XVI° kal. Junii apud Sciedam et in illis finibus horror cernitur, ubi dyabolo visibiliter comparente et in elementis cuncta, que voluit, operante tam clerus quam populus ad ecclesiam festinare dicitur. (drought)

SOURCE: Chronique Tournaisienne, ed. A. Hocquet, Croniques de Franche, d'Engleterre, de Flandres, de Lile et espécialement de Tournay, Société des bibliophiles belges séant à Mons 38, Mons 1938,
Peter of Zittau, Chronicon aulae regiae, ed. J. Emler, Fontes rerum Bohemicarum 4 (Prague, 1884)
SOURCE SUMMARY: hiemps fuit dura et aspera, per cuius hiemis asperitatem quam plurime fructuose et delicate arbores cum vinearum vitibus quasi radicitus in Alemanie partibus perierunt; estas sicca sine pluvia, inde semina estivalia defecerunt, hiemalibus tamen segetibus provenientibus competenter. (good spring grain harvest, poor summer harvest because of drought)

SOURCE: Annales S. Albini Andegavensis, Codex A note, ed. L. Halphen, Recueil d'annales angevines et vendômoises (Paris, 1903)
SOURCE SUMMARY: heavy rains  from 1349 to viii1351, causing great famine, but great harvest in 1352

SOURCE: Heinrich Truchsess von Diessenhofen, Chronica, ed. J. F. Boehmer, Fontes rerum germanicarum, 4 (Stuttgart, 1868)
SOURCE SUMMARY: good weather durg year until xi: ; cf. Year begins in archdioc Mainz on 25.xii, Bresslau 2:432, but phrasing here suggests it is later: Ipse autem annus cum magno temperie aeris incepit et permansit usque ad festum beati Andree (xi.30), et deinceps pluvia habundabat versus Nicolai (6.xii) sed deinceps frigus erat usque ad purificationem (2.ii). temperies seems to mean "mildness" notwithstanding ref to abundant rains ca. 6.xii unclear whether temperies excludes rain.

SOURCE: Annales Ratiborienses, ed. A. Wetzel, Zeitschrift des Vereins für Geschichte und Althertum Schlesiens  (1862)
SOURCE SUMMARY: Oder: 100 yr-flood: Odra fuit tam magnus, quod infra centum annos non fuit major, quia tunc omnes piscine circumadiacentes rupte erant, et oia in campis perierunt.

SOURCE: Chronique et annales de Gilles le Muisit, abbé de Saint-Martin de Tournai (1272-1352), ed. Henri Lemaître (Paris, 1906)
SOURCE SUMMARY: no freeze but heavy rains from x1349 to (at least)  ii1350, unusual fl in Scheldt and other rivers, meadows bcm lakes; also France: people expected disease (prayer to St. Sebastian), 259 ; iii dry and rather pleasant; iv: incompositus ("changeable"?), frigidus, et ventosus 268; summer fairly warm and dry (estas satis calida et gratiosa, i.e. pleasant): wonderful growth of grains and vines, leading to great expectations for harvest; calidum et amenum ("hot and pleasant") until first days viii; heavy rains until last week viii damage harvests, after last week viii weather bcms amenum ("pleasant") again, 269 :  heavy mortality from plague esp workers, salaries demands 267-8

SOURCE: P. F. Brandon, "Late-medieval weather in Sussex and its agricultural significance," Transactions of the Institute of British Geographers, 54 (1971): 1-17
SOURCE SUMMARY: dry spring in Sussex:

SOURCE: Heinrich Truchsess von Diessenhofen, Chronica, ed. J. F. Boehmer, Fontes rerum germanicarum, 4 (Stuttgart, 1868)
SOURCE SUMMARY: vi: beautiful hot weather, impossible to plow (i.e. dry so damages plows? Cf England), no hail:

SOURCE SUMMARY: good grape harvest in Alsace

SOURCE: Chronique et annales de Gilles le Muisit, abbé de Saint-Martin de Tournai (1272-1352), ed. Henri Lemaître (Paris, 1906) 311
SOURCE SUMMARY: (If Gilles is indeed referring to winter 1352-3 and not 1351-2): mild winter little snow, freezing; v dry, i and ii very mild: water shortage iii: started out v cold, big snow, but did not last:   A big rainstorm  ca 12.iv: Croniques de Franche, d'Engleterre de Flandres, de Lile et espécialement de Tournay, ed. A. Hocquet (Publications, Soc. des bibliophiles belges séant à Mons, 38: windstom 12.iii wrecks many chimneys etc., Et après xxxi jours pleut si fort que touttes les cauchies furent descirées, voire de la rue de Coulongne (!) et le Chainglre, et furent aucun celier si plain d'éave que les tonniaux de vin flotoient"; exceptionally heavy rains, flooding viii : poem included in + chron itself Chronique de Tournai, ed. J. J. de Smet, Corpus chronicorum Flandriae, 3(Bxl, 1856).180 GB

SOURCE: Chronicon Moguntinum (attrib. to Johannes Kungstein), ed. C. Hegel.  MGH SRG [20] (Hanover, 1885)
SOURCE SUMMARY: The Rhine flooded more than at any time in the previous 10 years; constant rain from 24.vi-8.ix; very few rays of the sun. Rhenum inundavit magis quam antea unquam in decem annis….Eo tempore continuate sunt pluvie super terram a festo nativitatis Iohannis baptiste usque ad nativitatem Marie virginisginis, et fuit aura nimium distemperata, quia raro potest contingi aliqua dies nisi plueret, et ex hoc magnus timor incussus est hominibus, nec radii solares nisi rarissime directi sunt super terram.

SOURCE: Chronique des règnes de Jean II et de Charles V, ed. R. Delachenal (Paris, 1910)
SOURCE SUMMARY: vii-beginning ix v rainy; wheat  germinated in fields; wine v exp; mad e worse by warfare.

SOURCE: Chronique valenciennoise, ed. E. Delcambre, "Une chronique valenciennoise inédite," Bulletin de la Commission royale d'histoire 94 (1930).1-102; Jean Froissart, Chroniques, par. 459, ed. S. Luce, 5 (Paris, 1874). 202.
SOURCE SUMMARY: Scheldt floods ii [Chron Valenciennoise]; x-xi: English army's horses have problems in Artois and Picardy, bc so rainy, wine harvest failed bc of rains [Jean Froissart Chroniques]

SOURCE: Continuatio Zwetlensis quarta, ed. W. Wattenbach, MGH SS 9 (1851)
SOURCE SUMMARY: heavy rain all summer

SOURCE: Chronicon Moguntinum (attrib. to Johannes Kungstein), ed. C. Hegel.  MGH SRG [20] (Hanover, 1885)
SOURCE SUMMARY: hot summer clear weather of most suitable sort even as winter had been mild and snowless, and no hail in summer; rains started only 8.ix and lasted until 29.ix so wine harvest accelerated. Ista estas erat calida et optima in temperie aeris, sicut melius poterat convenire, et precedens hiems fuit tam suavis et bona, quod aliquod frigus non apparuit in ea et transivit sine nivibus, sicut eciam estas predicta sine grandine nocente. Circa festum nativitatis Marie incepit aer distemperari cum pluviis et ventis, et duravit usque Michaelis, et acceleravit vindemia. Tunc mensura novi vini solvebat tres antiquos hallenses, et siligo solvebat libram etc 9 alb. 1 flor.

SOURCE: Philippe de Vigneulles, Chronique, ed. C. Bruneau, La chronique de Philippe de Vigneulles (Metz, 1927-1938), here 4(1929).63
SOURCE SUMMARY: After a food shortage with high prices, at harvest the good wheat harvest caused drop in price from 32 s. to 10 s. wine harvest, by St Remigius'feast (1 October?) it had dropped to 9 s., and by Easter, to 5 s. Wine too droppe from 50 s to 20.

SOURCE: Benesch of Weitmüll [alias Beneš of Weitmil], ed. J. Emler, Fontes rerum Bohemicarum 4(Prague, 1884), 457-548
SOURCE SUMMARY: big spring drought begins in iv, poor summer harvest of wheat

SOURCE SUMMARY: great flood ruins hay and linen (=viii)

SOURCE: Tilemann Ehlen von Wolfhagen, Limburger Chronik, ed. A. Wyss, 166, MGH Deutsche Chroniken 4.1 (1883)
SOURCE SUMMARY: hot summer: good wine, dry streams lowest in 40 years includg Rhine: "Unde in dem andern jare wart gut win, unde galt di qwarte zwene engels. Unde was der somer also hei, daz der Rin unde ander alle flißende waßer also kleine waren, als mani binnen virzig jaren zubefornt i mochte gesen."

SOURCE: Chronicon Moguntinum (attrib. to Johannes Kungstein), ed. C. Hegel.  MGH SRG [20] (Hanover, 1885)
SOURCE SUMMARY: very dry summer, streams dry up, cost of milling very dear, Rhine very low: partially could be crossed on foor, not much wine but excellent, poor cabbage harvest because of drought: estas multum sicca, ita quod molendo fuit multum carum et, nisi ripa notabiliter fuerit magna, aqua caruit, et Rhenus tam exiguus extitit, quod in medio Rheni circa cloacam magis siccus partim hominibus transitus patuit. Eodem anno quasi nullum Maguncie compositum [G. Kompost, Kraut, Kappis] crevit propter nimiam siccitatem et propter erucas ipsum corrodentes.

SOURCE: Annales Mellicenses, Continuatio Mellicensis, ed. W. Wattenbach, MGH SS 9 (1851)
SOURCE SUMMARY: great drought; hardly any could remember such:

SOURCE: Chronicon Bohemiae, ed. K. Höfler, Fontes rerum Austriacarum, Scriptores 6 (Vienna, 1856), 7-8.
SOURCE SUMMARY: Moldau dries up in summer: cld be crossed using a short piece of wood (brevem asserem) with dry feet; what water there was turned so green that people were afraid to cook with it and got well water.

SOURCE: Chronik der Stadt Zürich, ed. J. Dierauer, Quellen zur Schweizer Geschichte 18 (Basel, 1800)
SOURCE SUMMARY: after heavy snow freeze from Xmas until iii, hot weather: even so on 26.vi the water of the Zurichsee was as cold as any well, in fact, at the Water Wheel, one could hardly drink it was so cold. Summer hot and dry, no rain for 13 weeks; wells which never dried up did dry, lake level down low, early grape flowerg"(pre 16.vi), good wine, good wheat harvest, poor "little cereals" (smalsad).

SOURCE: J. Titow, "Le climat à travers les rôles de comptabilité de l'évêché de Winchester (1350-1450)", Annales. Économies, sociétés, civilisations 25 (1970): 312-350
SOURCE SUMMARY: summer v dry

SOURCE: Die Limburger Chronik, ed. A. Wyss, MGH Deutsche Chroniken 4,1 (1883)
SOURCE SUMMARY: flood Feb 16; vines flower in v, ripe in vi, wheat harvested 10.vi at Coblence: good wine Tilemann Ehlen v Wolfhagen, 4.1883: 92, 94 (excell grain/wine harvest); harvest dates from Limburger Annalen, Rec A ib 112

SOURCE: Wiener Annalen, ed. J. Seemüller, MGH Deutsche Chroniken 6 (1909)
SOURCE SUMMARY: great heat, worst drought in Austria in livg memory: no rain for many weeks from 15.iv, rare rains in early July; good wheat poor oats

SOURCE: "Schöffenchronik,"  ed. Karl Janicke, Chroniken der Deutschen Städten vom 14. bis ins 16. Jahrhundert 7:1 (1869).
SOURCE SUMMARY: ca 25 vii: highest in 100 yrs

SOURCE: Nürnberger Chronik bis 1434 (1441), ed. T. von Kern, Chroniken der deutschen Städte 1 (Leipzig, 1862)
SOURCE SUMMARY: Between 28.iii and 31.v freezing and drought; then began freq rain in vi, vii, vii and a flood: In dem jar nach ostern in dem maien da erfruren die wein gemeinlich in Francken und frucht und obs und ander ding allenthalben gemeinlich von reif und gefrust und wints wegen, und wart grosse durren darnach untz auf Petronelle. da regnet es darnach ie und ie lang und verderbte ser alles getrait, dass man nicht geschneiden mocht noch kunt, und wurden vil guss nach einander untz auf den herbst; von dem regnet es disen monast gantz, dass man nicht geseen mocht vor wasser untz auf das new [jar? ed.]. da war es schon hinnach.

SOURCE: Journal d'un Bourgeois de Paris: A Parisian Journal  1405-1449, tr. J. Shirley (Oxford, 1968), in Jan Buisman, Duizend jaar weer, wind en water in de Lage Landen 2 (Franeker, 1996)
SOURCE SUMMARY: Paris: iii: dry and as warm as summer; iv v dry also

SOURCE: local archives: Jan Buisman, Duizend jaar weer, wind en water in de Lage Landen (Franeker, 1996)
SOURCE SUMMARY: v: Meuse is low

SOURCE: Chronik des Johann Kerkhörde von 1405-1465, ed. J. Franck and J. Hansen, Die Chroniken der deutschen Städte 20 (Leipzig, 1887)

SOURCE SUMMARY: ca. 13.vii: flood which washed away mill and house in a great lightning and thunder storm. The thunder that year was unlike anything similar for years.

SOURCE: Jehan Aubrion, Journal: Journal de Jehan Aubrion bourgeois de Metz avec sa continuation par Pierre Aubrion, 1465-1512, ed. Lorédan Larchey, Metz, 1857
SOURCE SUMMARY: Fine weather began on 19 February: it froze every AM, but the weather was so fine that it seemed to be mid-summer, and it stayed that way until 17 March when the rain came. But good wheat and (194) wine harvest

SOURCE: local archives cited by J. Buisman and A.F.V. van Engelen, Duizend jaar weer, wind en water in de Lage Landen 3 (Franeker, 1998)
SOURCE SUMMARY: Twente (Utrecht): wet summer

SOURCE: "Annotations  sur les années 1401 à 1506," ed. S. Balau and E. Fairon, Chroniques liégeoises 2 (Brussels, 1931).237-272
SOURCE SUMMARY: summer warm & dry: no rain for 4 mos: "... l'hyver fut durs, aspre et long et l'esté fort chault, dur et sèche, car en quattre moys ne pleut, tellement que les herbes devindrent sèches avant venir à parfaicte croissance et maturation. On ne eut aulcunes aveines, peu de bledz et fut grande mortalité entre les pourceaux."

SOURCE: T. von Liebenau, ed. "Chronik des Anton Tegerfeld," Argovia 14 (1884): 209-300
SOURCE SUMMARY: hot summer hurts germinating garden crops, onion

SOURCE: Jehan Aubrion, Journal: Journal de Jehan Aubrion bourgeois de Metz avec sa continuation par Pierre Aubrion, 1465-1512, ed. Lorédan Larchey, Metz, 1857
SOURCE SUMMARY: drought in May-17 June: "Item, le moix de may fut bel et chault, et fit sy grant chaleur qui durait par tout le mois, et encore jusques au sabmedy, xvije de jung, que, durant le dit temps, il n'avoit point cheu une seule goule d'eawe, en telle manière que tout sachoit et se perdoit. Et estoient les herbes touttes saches, et les eawes sy merveilleusement cortes, que chacun s'en donnoil grant merveille. Laquelle pluye, qui cheut le dit sabmedy, fit tant de bien sur la terre que on ne pouroit croire, tant pour les vignes, bley et avenne, comme pour touttes aultres."

SOURCE: Henricus van der Heyden, Chronicon Campense,  ed. H. Keussen,  Chronicon monasterii Campensis ordin. Ciserciensis," Annalen des historischen Vereins Niederrhein 20.1869.261-360
SOURCE SUMMARY: Summer was very hot and dry, such that crops of soil and trees in many places withered and in some places grew. Many of the ditchs around the monastery and woods and fields were redug because of the dryness of the earth. "Anno domini 1503 fuit estas nimis calida et arida. ita fructus terre et arborum in multis locis exaruerunt et in aliis locis competenter creuerunt. Et eodem anno propter terre siccitatem renouata fuerunt multa fossata circa monasterium Campense et circa nemora et agros."

SOURCE: "Chronijk der landen van Overmaas en der aagrenzende gewesten," ed. J. Habets, Publications de la société historique et archéologique dans le duché de Limbourg 7 (1870).5-197
SOURCE SUMMARY: very dry summer: "Item in dit selve joere vurs. So waest eyn ser drughe somer.

SOURCE: T. von Liebenau, ed. "Chronik des Anton Tegerfeld," Argovia 14 (1884): 209-300
SOURCE SUMMARY: hot summer hurts germinating garden crops, onion

SOURCE: Henricus van der Heyden, Chronicon Campense,  ed. H. Keussen, "Chronicon monasterii Campensis ordin. Ciserciensis," Annalen des historischen Vereins für den Niederrhein 20 (1869): 261-360
SOURCE SUMMARY: long hot summer almost without rain, such that shrubs dried up in many places and not much wheat grew. Caterpillar plague in May: "Anno domini 1504 fuit estas longa sicca et calida et quodammodo sine pluuia ita ut arbusta in multis exaruerunt et pauca blada creuerunt. Eodem tempore in mense maio fuit plaga erucarum innumerabilium que fructus et folia arbor um deuastauerunt sic quod in multis locis parum creuerunt et glandes et faga omnino defecerunt."

SOURCE: "Auszüge aus den Soester Stadtbüchern," ed. T. Ilgen, in Die Chroniken der deutschen Städte vom 14. bis ins 16. Jahrhundert, vol. 24 (Leipzig, 1895).
SOURCE SUMMARY: v hot (v dry) plants die, summer lasted until ix.2
